alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 05 at 3:48AM MDT until April 06 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch at lower elevations, 1 to 2 inches on Marias Pass, and up to 4 inches above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until 1 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions at lower elevations, and snow covered roads on Marias Pass. Blowing snow will reduce visibility to less than one mile at times, mainly at and above pass level. The hazardous conditions will impact both the morning and afternoon commutes today.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
